author: Special Correspondent
text:
An Árayar being carried in a palanquin in one of the streets adjoining Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple at Srirangam amid police security on Thursday.— Photo: M. Srinath

Ten members of the Periyar Dravidar Kazhagam and two others from Periyar Viduthalai Kazhagam were arrested after they attempted to stage an agitation opposing the “Brahma Ratham” ritual at the Srirangam Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple that was held on Thursday.

The “Brahma Ratham” is a ritual wherein a ‘Bhattar’ and an ‘Arayar’ are carried on different days on a palanquin in recognition of their knowledge, devotion and service to the almighty.

Opposing the ritual saying that human should not carry another human in a palanquin, a group of members of both outfits holding flags assembled at the South Chithirai street to stage an agitation.

A posse of police personnel were deployed in view of the agitation call given by the two outfits. The protestors were arrested immediately even as they assembled at the spot. Police sources said the arrested persons were later taken to a marriage hall.

Meanwhile, an ‘Arayar’ was carried on a palanquin on Thursday amid police security in the temple town.
title: 12 held for opposing Brahma Ratham
